subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Probably {{der|zh|sit}}. Proposed etymologies:
* STEDT relates it to {{cog|sit-pro|*mi||girl; female; feminine suffix}}, whence {{cog|apt|nyimii||girl; woman; female}}, {{cog|tbq-lol-pro|*C-mi²||woman}}, {{cog|kar-pro|*hmɨᴮ||female; woman}}.
* {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} compares it to {{cog|my|မ||sister}} (whence {{m|my|အစ်မ||elder sister}}, {{m|my|ညီမ||younger sister}}), {{cog|mxj|ku-mai-||woman}}, {{cog|bo|བུད་མེད||woman}}, and also {{cog|lus|hmei||concubine}} (> {{cog|lus|hmei-chhia||woman; wife}}), which STEDT relates to {{cog|sit-pro|*s-maj||widow, widower}} instead.
